Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/sin_cos.c

1/* mpfr_sin_cos -- sine and cosine of a floating-point number
2

4Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
5
6This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
7
8The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26/* (y, z) <- (sin(x), cos(x)), return value is 0 iff both results are exact
27 ie, iff x = 0 */
28int
29mpfr_sin_cos (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_ptr z, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
30{
31 mpfr_prec_t prec, m;
32 int neg, reduce;
33 mpfr_t c, xr;
34 mpfr_srcptr xx;
35 mpfr_exp_t err, expx;
36 int inexy, inexz;
37 MPFR_ZIV_DECL (loop);
38 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
39
40 MPFR_ASSERTN (y != z);
41
42 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x)))
43 {
44 if (MPFR_IS_NAN(x) || MPFR_IS_INF(x))
45 {
46 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
47 MPFR_SET_NAN (z);
48 MPFR_RET_NAN;
49 }
50 else /* x is zero */
51 {
52 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_ZERO (x));
53 MPFR_SET_ZERO (y);
54 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN (y, x);
55 /* y = 0, thus exact, but z is inexact in case of underflow
56 or overflow */
57 inexy = 0; /* y is exact */
58 inexz = mpfr_set_ui (z, 1, rnd_mode);
59 return INEX(inexy,inexz);
60 }
61 }
62
63 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
64 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d", mpfr_get_prec (x), mpfr_log_prec, x, rnd_mode),
65 ("sin[%Pu]=%.*Rg cos[%Pu]=%.*Rg", mpfr_get_prec(y), mpfr_log_prec, y,
66 mpfr_get_prec (z), mpfr_log_prec, z));
67
68 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
69
70 prec = MAX (MPFR_PREC (y), MPFR_PREC (z));
71 m = prec + MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (prec) + 13;
72 expx = MPFR_GET_EXP (x);
73
74 /* When x is close to 0, say 2^(-k), then there is a cancellation of about
75 2k bits in 1-cos(x)^2. FIXME: in that case, it would be more efficient
76 to compute sin(x) directly. VL: This is partly done by using
77 MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT from the mpfr_sin and mpfr_cos
78 functions. Moreover, any overflow on m is avoided. */
79 if (expx < 0)
80 {
81 /* Warning: in case y = x, and the first call to
82 MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT succeeds but the second fails,
83 we will have clobbered the original value of x.
84 The workaround is to first compute z = cos(x) in that case, since
85 y and z are different. */
86 if (y != x)
87 /* y and x differ, thus we can safely try to compute y first */
88 {
89 MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT (
90 y, x, -2 * expx, 2, 0, rnd_mode,
91 { inexy = _inexact;
92 goto small_input; });
93 if (0)
94 {
95 small_input:
96 /* we can go here only if we can round sin(x) */
97 MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT (
98 z, __gmpfr_one, -2 * expx, 1, 0, rnd_mode,
99 { inexz = _inexact;
100 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, __gmpfr_flags);
101 goto end; });
102 }
103
104 /* if we go here, one of the two MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT
105 calls failed */
106 }
107 else /* y and x are the same variable: try to compute z first, which
108 necessarily differs */
109 {
110 MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT (
111 z, __gmpfr_one, -2 * expx, 1, 0, rnd_mode,
112 { inexz = _inexact;
113 goto small_input2; });
114 if (0)
115 {
116 small_input2:
117 /* we can go here only if we can round cos(x) */
118 MPFR_FAST_COMPUTE_IF_SMALL_INPUT (
119 y, x, -2 * expx, 2, 0, rnd_mode,
120 { inexy = _inexact;
121 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, __gmpfr_flags);
122 goto end; });
123 }
124 }
125 m += 2 * (-expx);
126 }
127
128 if (prec >= MPFR_SINCOS_THRESHOLD)
129 {
130 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
131 return mpfr_sincos_fast (y, z, x, rnd_mode);
132 }
133
134 mpfr_init (c);
135 mpfr_init (xr);
136
137 MPFR_ZIV_INIT (loop, m);
138 for (;;)
139 {
140 /* the following is copied from sin.c */
141 if (expx >= 2) /* reduce the argument */
142 {
143 reduce = 1;
144 mpfr_set_prec (c, expx + m - 1);
145 mpfr_set_prec (xr, m);
146 mpfr_const_pi (c, MPFR_RNDN);
147 mpfr_mul_2ui (c, c, 1, MPFR_RNDN);
148 mpfr_remainder (xr, x, c, MPFR_RNDN);
149 mpfr_div_2ui (c, c, 1, MPFR_RNDN);
150 if (MPFR_IS_POS (xr))
151 mpfr_sub (c, c, xr, MPFR_RNDZ);
152 else
153 mpfr_add (c, c, xr, MPFR_RNDZ);
154 if (MPFR_IS_ZERO(xr)
155 || MPFR_EXP(xr) < (mpfr_exp_t) 3 - (mpfr_exp_t) m
156 || MPFR_EXP(c) < (mpfr_exp_t) 3 - (mpfr_exp_t) m)
157 goto next_step;
158 xx = xr;
159 }
160 else /* the input argument is already reduced */
161 {
162 reduce = 0;
163 xx = x;
164 }
165
166 neg = MPFR_IS_NEG (xx); /* gives sign of sin(x) */
167 mpfr_set_prec (c, m);
168 mpfr_cos (c, xx, MPFR_RNDZ);
169 /* If no argument reduction was performed, the error is at most ulp(c),
170 otherwise it is at most ulp(c) + 2^(2-m). Since |c| < 1, we have
171 ulp(c) <= 2^(-m), thus the error is bounded by 2^(3-m) in that later
172 case. */
173 if (reduce == 0)
174 err = m;
175 else
176 err = MPFR_GET_EXP (c) + (mpfr_exp_t) (m - 3);
177 if (!MPFR_CAN_ROUND (c, err, MPFR_PREC (z), rnd_mode))
178 goto next_step;
179
180 /* we can't set z now, because in case z = x, and the MPFR_CAN_ROUND()
181 call below fails, we will have clobbered the input */
182 mpfr_set_prec (xr, MPFR_PREC(c));
183 mpfr_swap (xr, c); /* save the approximation of the cosine in xr */
184 mpfr_sqr (c, xr, MPFR_RNDU); /* the absolute error is bounded by
185 2^(5-m) if reduce=1, and by 2^(2-m)
186 otherwise */
187 mpfr_ui_sub (c, 1, c, MPFR_RNDN); /* error bounded by 2^(6-m) if reduce
188 is 1, and 2^(3-m) otherwise */
189 mpfr_sqrt (c, c, MPFR_RNDN); /* the absolute error is bounded by
190 2^(6-m-Exp(c)) if reduce=1, and
191 2^(3-m-Exp(c)) otherwise */
192 err = 3 + 3 * reduce - MPFR_GET_EXP (c);
193 if (neg)
194 MPFR_CHANGE_SIGN (c);
195
196 /* the absolute error on c is at most 2^(err-m), which we must put
197 in the form 2^(EXP(c)-err). */
198 err = MPFR_GET_EXP (c) + (mpfr_exp_t) m - err;
199 if (MPFR_CAN_ROUND (c, err, MPFR_PREC (y), rnd_mode))
200 break;
201 /* check for huge cancellation */
202 if (err < (mpfr_exp_t) MPFR_PREC (y))
203 m += MPFR_PREC (y) - err;
204 /* Check if near 1 */
205 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (c) == 1
206 && MPFR_MANT (c)[MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (c)-1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
207 m += m;
208
209 next_step:
210 MPFR_ZIV_NEXT (loop, m);
211 mpfr_set_prec (c, m);
212 }
213 MPFR_ZIV_FREE (loop);
214
215 inexy = mpfr_set (y, c, rnd_mode);
216 inexz = mpfr_set (z, xr, rnd_mode);
217
218 mpfr_clear (c);
219 mpfr_clear (xr);
220
221 end:
222 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
223 /* FIXME: add a test for bug before revision 7355 */
224 inexy = mpfr_check_range (y, inexy, rnd_mode);
225 inexz = mpfr_check_range (z, inexz, rnd_mode);
226 MPFR_RET (INEX(inexy,inexz));
227}
228
229/*************** asymptotically fast implementation below ********************/
230
231/* truncate Q from R to at most prec bits.
232 Return the number of truncated bits.
233 */
234static mpfr_prec_t
235reduce (mpz_t Q, mpz_srcptr R, mpfr_prec_t prec)
236{
237 mpfr_prec_t l;
238
239 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(l, R);
240 l = (l > prec) ? l - prec : 0;
241 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (Q, R, l);
242 return l;
243}
244
245/* truncate S and C so that the smaller has prec bits.
246 Return the number of truncated bits.
247 */
248static unsigned long
249reduce2 (mpz_t S, mpz_t C, mpfr_prec_t prec)
250{
251 unsigned long ls;
252 unsigned long lc;
253 unsigned long l;
254
255 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(ls, S);
256 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(lc, C);
257
258 l = (ls < lc) ? ls : lc; /* smaller length */
259 l = (l > prec) ? l - prec : 0;
260 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (S, S, l);
261 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (C, C, l);
262 return l;
263}
264
265/* return in S0/Q0 a rational approximation of sin(X) with absolute error
266 bounded by 9*2^(-prec), where 0 <= X=p/2^r <= 1/2,
267 and in C0/Q0 a rational approximation of cos(X), with relative error
268 bounded by 9*2^(-prec) (and also absolute error, since
269 |cos(X)| <= 1).
270 We have sin(X)/X = sum((-1)^i*(p/2^r)^i/(2i+1)!, i=0..infinity).
271 We use the following binary splitting formula:
272 P(a,b) = (-p)^(b-a)
273 Q(a,b) = (2a)*(2a+1)*2^r if a+1=b [except Q(0,1)=1], Q(a,c)*Q(c,b) otherwise
274 T(a,b) = 1 if a+1=b, Q(c,b)*T(a,c)+P(a,c)*T(c,b) otherwise.
275
276 Since we use P(a,b) for b-a=2^k only, we compute only p^(2^k).
277 We do not store the factor 2^r in Q().
278
279 Then sin(X)/X ~ T(0,i)/Q(0,i) for i so that (p/2^r)^i/i! is small enough.
280
281 Return l such that Q0 has to be multiplied by 2^l.
282
283 Assumes prec >= 10.
284*/
285static unsigned long
286sin_bs_aux (mpz_t Q0, mpz_t S0, mpz_t C0, mpz_srcptr p, mpfr_prec_t r,
287 mpfr_prec_t prec)
288{
289 mpz_t T[GMP_NUMB_BITS], Q[GMP_NUMB_BITS], ptoj[GMP_NUMB_BITS], pp;
290 mpfr_prec_t log2_nb_terms[GMP_NUMB_BITS], mult[GMP_NUMB_BITS];
291 mpfr_prec_t accu[GMP_NUMB_BITS], size_ptoj[GMP_NUMB_BITS];
292 mpfr_prec_t prec_i_have, h, r0 = r, pp_s, p_s;
293 unsigned long i, j, m;
294 int alloc, k, l;
295
296 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(mpz_cmp_ui (p, 0) == 0)) /* sin(x)/x -> 1 */
297 {
298 mpz_set_ui (Q0, 1);
299 mpz_set_ui (S0, 1);
300 mpz_set_ui (C0, 1);
301 return 0;
302 }
303
304 /* check that X=p/2^r <= 1/2 */
305 MPFR_ASSERTN(mpz_sizeinbase (p, 2) - (mpfr_exp_t) r <= -1);
306
307 mpz_init (pp);
308
309 /* normalize p (non-zero here) */
310 h = mpz_scan1 (p, 0);
311 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (pp, p, h); /* p = pp * 2^h */
312 mpz_mul (pp, pp, pp);
313 r = 2 * (r - h); /* x^2 = (p/2^r0)^2 = pp / 2^r */
314
315 /* now p is odd */
316 alloc = 2;
317 mpz_init_set_ui (T[0], 6);
318 mpz_init_set_ui (Q[0], 6);
319 mpz_init_set (ptoj[0], pp); /* ptoj[i] = pp^(2^i) */
320 mpz_init (T[1]);
321 mpz_init (Q[1]);
322 mpz_init (ptoj[1]);
323 mpz_mul (ptoj[1], pp, pp); /* ptoj[1] = pp^2 */
324 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(size_ptoj[1], ptoj[1]);
325
326 mpz_mul_2exp (T[0], T[0], r);
327 mpz_sub (T[0], T[0], pp); /* 6*2^r - pp = 6*2^r*(1 - x^2/6) */
328 log2_nb_terms[0] = 1;
329
330 /* already take into account the factor x=p/2^r in sin(x) = x * (...) */
331 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(pp_s, pp);
332 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(p_s, p);
333 mult[0] = r - pp_s + r0 - p_s;
334 /* we have x^3 < 1/2^mult[0] */
335
336 for (i = 2, k = 0, prec_i_have = mult[0]; prec_i_have < prec; i += 2)
337 {
338 /* i is even here */
339 /* invariant: Q[0]*Q[1]*...*Q[k] equals (2i-1)!,
340 we have already summed terms of index < i
341 in S[0]/Q[0], ..., S[k]/Q[k] */
342 k ++;
343 if (k + 1 >= alloc) /* necessarily k + 1 = alloc */
344 {
345 alloc ++;
346 mpz_init (T[k+1]);
347 mpz_init (Q[k+1]);
348 mpz_init (ptoj[k+1]);
349 mpz_mul (ptoj[k+1], ptoj[k], ptoj[k]); /* pp^(2^(k+1)) */
350 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(size_ptoj[k+1], ptoj[k+1]);
351 }
352 /* for i even, we have Q[k] = (2*i)*(2*i+1), T[k] = 1,
353 then Q[k+1] = (2*i+2)*(2*i+3), T[k+1] = 1,
354 which reduces to T[k] = (2*i+2)*(2*i+3)*2^r-pp,
355 Q[k] = (2*i)*(2*i+1)*(2*i+2)*(2*i+3). */
356 log2_nb_terms[k] = 1;
357 mpz_set_ui (Q[k], 2 * i + 2);
358 mpz_mul_ui (Q[k], Q[k], 2 * i + 3);
359 mpz_mul_2exp (T[k], Q[k], r);
360 mpz_sub (T[k], T[k], pp);
361 mpz_mul_ui (Q[k], Q[k], 2 * i);
362 mpz_mul_ui (Q[k], Q[k], 2 * i + 1);
363 /* the next term of the series is divided by Q[k] and multiplied
364 by pp^2/2^(2r), thus the mult. factor < 1/2^mult[k] */
365 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(mult[k], Q[k]);
366 mult[k] += 2 * r - size_ptoj[1] - 1;
367 /* the absolute contribution of the next term is 1/2^accu[k] */
368 accu[k] = (k == 0) ? mult[k] : mult[k] + accu[k-1];
369 prec_i_have = accu[k]; /* the current term is < 1/2^accu[k] */
370 j = (i + 2) / 2;
371 l = 1;
372 while ((j & 1) == 0) /* combine and reduce */
373 {
374 mpz_mul (T[k], T[k], ptoj[l]);
375 mpz_mul (T[k-1], T[k-1], Q[k]);
376 mpz_mul_2exp (T[k-1], T[k-1], r << l);
377 mpz_add (T[k-1], T[k-1], T[k]);
378 mpz_mul (Q[k-1], Q[k-1], Q[k]);
379 log2_nb_terms[k-1] ++; /* number of terms in S[k-1]
380 is a power of 2 by construction */
381 MPFR_MPZ_SIZEINBASE2(prec_i_have, Q[k]);
382 mult[k-1] += prec_i_have + (r << l) - size_ptoj[l] - 1;
383 accu[k-1] = (k == 1) ? mult[k-1] : mult[k-1] + accu[k-2];
384 prec_i_have = accu[k-1];
385 l ++;
386 j >>= 1;
387 k --;
388 }
389 }
390
391 /* accumulate all products in T[0] and Q[0]. Warning: contrary to above,
392 here we do not have log2_nb_terms[k-1] = log2_nb_terms[k]+1. */
393 h = 0; /* number of accumulated terms in the right part T[k]/Q[k] */
394 while (k > 0)
395 {
396 mpz_mul (T[k], T[k], ptoj[log2_nb_terms[k-1]]);
397 mpz_mul (T[k-1], T[k-1], Q[k]);
398 h += (mpfr_prec_t) 1 << log2_nb_terms[k];
399 mpz_mul_2exp (T[k-1], T[k-1], r * h);
400 mpz_add (T[k-1], T[k-1], T[k]);
401 mpz_mul (Q[k-1], Q[k-1], Q[k]);
402 k--;
403 }
404
405 m = r0 + r * (i - 1); /* implicit multiplier 2^r for Q0 */
406 /* at this point T[0]/(2^m*Q[0]) is an approximation of sin(x) where the 1st
407 neglected term has contribution < 1/2^prec, thus since the series has
408 alternate signs, the error is < 1/2^prec */
409
410 /* we truncate Q0 to prec bits: the relative error is at most 2^(1-prec),
411 which means that Q0 = Q[0] * (1+theta) with |theta| <= 2^(1-prec)
412 [up to a power of two] */
413 m += reduce (Q0, Q[0], prec);
414 m -= reduce (T[0], T[0], prec);
415 /* multiply by x = p/2^m */
416 mpz_mul (S0, T[0], p);
417 m -= reduce (S0, S0, prec); /* S0 = T[0] * (1 + theta)^2 up to power of 2 */
418 /* sin(X) ~ S0/Q0*(1 + theta)^3 + err with |theta| <= 2^(1-prec) and
419 |err| <= 2^(-prec), thus since |S0/Q0| <= 1:
420 |sin(X) - S0/Q0| <= 4*|theta*S0/Q0| + |err| <= 9*2^(-prec) */
421
422 mpz_clear (pp);
423 for (k = 0; k < alloc; k ++)
424 {
425 mpz_clear (T[k]);
426 mpz_clear (Q[k]);
427 mpz_clear (ptoj[k]);
428 }
429
430 /* compute cos(X) from sin(X): sqrt(1-(S/Q)^2) = sqrt(Q^2-S^2)/Q
431 = sqrt(Q0^2*2^(2m)-S0^2)/Q0.
432 Write S/Q = sin(X) + eps with |eps| <= 9*2^(-prec),
433 then sqrt(Q^2-S^2) = sqrt(Q^2-Q^2*(sin(X)+eps)^2)
434 = sqrt(Q^2*cos(X)^2-Q^2*(2*sin(X)*eps+eps^2))
435 = sqrt(Q^2*cos(X)^2-Q^2*eps1) with |eps1|<=9*2^(-prec)
436 [using X<=1/2 and eps<=9*2^(-prec) and prec>=10]
437
438 Since we truncate the square root, we get:
439 sqrt(Q^2*cos(X)^2-Q^2*eps1)+eps2 with |eps2|<1
440 = Q*sqrt(cos(X)^2-eps1)+eps2
441 = Q*cos(X)*(1+eps3)+eps2 with |eps3| <= 6*2^(-prec)
442 = Q*cos(X)*(1+eps3+eps2/(Q*cos(X)))
443 = Q*cos(X)*(1+eps4) with |eps4| <= 9*2^(-prec)
444 since |Q| >= 2^(prec-1) */
445 /* we assume that Q0*2^m >= 2^(prec-1) */
446 MPFR_ASSERTN(m + mpz_sizeinbase (Q0, 2) >= prec);
447 mpz_mul (C0, Q0, Q0);
448 mpz_mul_2exp (C0, C0, 2 * m);
449 mpz_submul (C0, S0, S0);
450 mpz_sqrt (C0, C0);
451
452 return m;
453}
454
455/* Put in s and c approximations of sin(x) and cos(x) respectively.
456 Assumes 0 < x < Pi/4 and PREC(s) = PREC(c) >= 10.
457 Return err such that the relative error is bounded by 2^err ulps.
458*/
459static int
460sincos_aux (mpfr_t s, mpfr_t c, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
461{
462 mpfr_prec_t prec_s, sh;
463 mpz_t Q, S, C, Q2, S2, C2, y;
464 mpfr_t x2;
465 unsigned long l, l2, j, err;
466
467 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(s) == MPFR_PREC(c));
468
469 prec_s = MPFR_PREC(s);
470
471 mpfr_init2 (x2, MPFR_PREC(x));
472 mpz_init (Q);
473 mpz_init (S);
474 mpz_init (C);
475 mpz_init (Q2);
476 mpz_init (S2);
477 mpz_init (C2);
478 mpz_init (y);
479
480 mpfr_set (x2, x, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
481 mpz_set_ui (Q, 1);
482 l = 0;
483 mpz_set_ui (S, 0); /* sin(0) = S/(2^l*Q), exact */
484 mpz_set_ui (C, 1); /* cos(0) = C/(2^l*Q), exact */
485
486 /* Invariant: x = X + x2/2^(sh-1), where the part X was already treated,
487 S/(2^l*Q) ~ sin(X), C/(2^l*Q) ~ cos(X), and x2/2^(sh-1) < Pi/4.
488 'sh-1' is the number of already shifted bits in x2.
489 */
490
491 for (sh = 1, j = 0; mpfr_cmp_ui (x2, 0) != 0 && sh <= prec_s; sh <<= 1, j++)
492 {
493 if (sh > prec_s / 2) /* sin(x) = x + O(x^3), cos(x) = 1 + O(x^2) */
494 {
495 l2 = -mpfr_get_z_2exp (S2, x2); /* S2/2^l2 = x2 */
496 l2 += sh - 1;
497 mpz_set_ui (Q2, 1);
498 mpz_set_ui (C2, 1);
499 mpz_mul_2exp (C2, C2, l2);
500 mpfr_set_ui (x2, 0, MPFR_RNDN);
501 }
502 else
503 {
504 /* y <- trunc(x2 * 2^sh) = trunc(x * 2^(2*sh-1)) */
505 mpfr_mul_2exp (x2, x2, sh, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
506 mpfr_get_z (y, x2, MPFR_RNDZ); /* round toward zero: now
507 0 <= x2 < 2^sh, thus
508 0 <= x2/2^(sh-1) < 2^(1-sh) */
509 if (mpz_cmp_ui (y, 0) == 0)
510 continue;
511 mpfr_sub_z (x2, x2, y, MPFR_RNDN); /* should be exact */
512 l2 = sin_bs_aux (Q2, S2, C2, y, 2 * sh - 1, prec_s);
513 /* we now have |S2/Q2/2^l2 - sin(X)| <= 9*2^(prec_s)
514 and |C2/Q2/2^l2 - cos(X)| <= 6*2^(prec_s), with X=y/2^(2sh-1) */
515 }
516 if (sh == 1) /* S=0, C=1 */
517 {
518 l = l2;
519 mpz_swap (Q, Q2);
520 mpz_swap (S, S2);
521 mpz_swap (C, C2);
522 }
523 else
524 {
525 /* s <- s*c2+c*s2, c <- c*c2-s*s2, using Karatsuba:
526 a = s+c, b = s2+c2, t = a*b, d = s*s2, e = c*c2,
527 s <- t - d - e, c <- e - d */
528 mpz_add (y, S, C); /* a */
529 mpz_mul (C, C, C2); /* e */
530 mpz_add (C2, C2, S2); /* b */
531 mpz_mul (S2, S, S2); /* d */
532 mpz_mul (y, y, C2); /* a*b */
533 mpz_sub (S, y, S2); /* t - d */
534 mpz_sub (S, S, C); /* t - d - e */
535 mpz_sub (C, C, S2); /* e - d */
536 mpz_mul (Q, Q, Q2);
537 /* after j loops, the error is <= (11j-2)*2^(prec_s) */
538 l += l2;
539 /* reduce Q to prec_s bits */
540 l += reduce (Q, Q, prec_s);
541 /* reduce S,C to prec_s bits, error <= 11*j*2^(prec_s) */
542 l -= reduce2 (S, C, prec_s);
543 }
544 }
545
546 j = 11 * j;
547 for (err = 0; j > 1; j = (j + 1) / 2, err ++);
548
549 mpfr_set_z (s, S, MPFR_RNDN);
550 mpfr_div_z (s, s, Q, MPFR_RNDN);
551 mpfr_div_2exp (s, s, l, MPFR_RNDN);
552
553 mpfr_set_z (c, C, MPFR_RNDN);
554 mpfr_div_z (c, c, Q, MPFR_RNDN);
555 mpfr_div_2exp (c, c, l, MPFR_RNDN);
556
557 mpz_clear (Q);
558 mpz_clear (S);
559 mpz_clear (C);
560 mpz_clear (Q2);
561 mpz_clear (S2);
562 mpz_clear (C2);
563 mpz_clear (y);
564 mpfr_clear (x2);
565 return err;
566}
567
568/* Assumes x is neither NaN, +/-Inf, nor +/- 0.
569 One of s and c might be NULL, in which case the corresponding value is
570 not computed.
571 Assumes s differs from c.
572 */
573int
574mpfr_sincos_fast (mpfr_t s, mpfr_t c, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
575{
576 int inexs, inexc;
577 mpfr_t x_red, ts, tc;
578 mpfr_prec_t w;
579 mpfr_exp_t err, errs, errc;
580 MPFR_GROUP_DECL (group);
581 MPFR_ZIV_DECL (loop);
582
583 MPFR_ASSERTN(s != c);
584 if (s == NULL)
585 w = MPFR_PREC(c);
586 else if (c == NULL)
587 w = MPFR_PREC(s);
588 else
589 w = MPFR_PREC(s) >= MPFR_PREC(c) ? MPFR_PREC(s) : MPFR_PREC(c);
590 w += MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2(w) + 9; /* ensures w >= 10 (needed by sincos_aux) */
591
592 MPFR_GROUP_INIT_2(group, w, ts, tc);
593
594 MPFR_ZIV_INIT (loop, w);
595 for (;;)
596 {
597 /* if 0 < x <= Pi/4, we can call sincos_aux directly */
598 if (MPFR_IS_POS(x) && mpfr_cmp_ui_2exp (x, 1686629713, -31) <= 0)
599 {
600 err = sincos_aux (ts, tc, x, MPFR_RNDN);
601 }
602 /* if -Pi/4 <= x < 0, use sin(-x)=-sin(x) */
603 else if (MPFR_IS_NEG(x) && mpfr_cmp_si_2exp (x, -1686629713, -31) >= 0)
604 {
605 MPFR_ALIAS(x_red, x, MPFR_SIGN_POS, MPFR_GET_EXP(x));
606 err = sincos_aux (ts, tc, x_red, MPFR_RNDN);
607 MPFR_CHANGE_SIGN(ts);
608 }
609 else /* argument reduction is needed */
610 {
611 long q;
612 mpfr_t pi;
613 int neg = 0;
614
615 mpfr_init2 (x_red, w);
616 mpfr_init2 (pi, (MPFR_EXP(x) > 0) ? w + MPFR_EXP(x) : w);
617 mpfr_const_pi (pi, MPFR_RNDN);
618 mpfr_div_2exp (pi, pi, 1, MPFR_RNDN); /* Pi/2 */
619 mpfr_remquo (x_red, &q, x, pi, MPFR_RNDN);
620 /* x = q * (Pi/2 + eps1) + x_red + eps2,
621 where |eps1| <= 1/2*ulp(Pi/2) = 2^(-w-MAX(0,EXP(x))),
622 and eps2 <= 1/2*ulp(x_red) <= 1/2*ulp(Pi/2) = 2^(-w)
623 Since |q| <= x/(Pi/2) <= |x|, we have
624 q*|eps1| <= 2^(-w), thus
625 |x - q * Pi/2 - x_red| <= 2^(1-w) */
626 /* now -Pi/4 <= x_red <= Pi/4: if x_red < 0, consider -x_red */
627 if (MPFR_IS_NEG(x_red))
628 {
629 mpfr_neg (x_red, x_red, MPFR_RNDN);
630 neg = 1;
631 }
632 err = sincos_aux (ts, tc, x_red, MPFR_RNDN);
633 err ++; /* to take into account the argument reduction */
634 if (neg) /* sin(-x) = -sin(x), cos(-x) = cos(x) */
635 mpfr_neg (ts, ts, MPFR_RNDN);
636 if (q & 2) /* sin(x+Pi) = -sin(x), cos(x+Pi) = -cos(x) */
637 {
638 mpfr_neg (ts, ts, MPFR_RNDN);
639 mpfr_neg (tc, tc, MPFR_RNDN);
640 }
641 if (q & 1) /* sin(x+Pi/2) = cos(x), cos(x+Pi/2) = -sin(x) */
642 {
643 mpfr_neg (ts, ts, MPFR_RNDN);
644 mpfr_swap (ts, tc);
645 }
646 mpfr_clear (x_red);
647 mpfr_clear (pi);
648 }
649 /* adjust errors with respect to absolute values */
650 errs = err - MPFR_EXP(ts);
651 errc = err - MPFR_EXP(tc);
652 if ((s == NULL || MPFR_CAN_ROUND (ts, w - errs, MPFR_PREC(s), rnd)) &&
653 (c == NULL || MPFR_CAN_ROUND (tc, w - errc, MPFR_PREC(c), rnd)))
654 break;
655 MPFR_ZIV_NEXT (loop, w);
656 MPFR_GROUP_REPREC_2(group, w, ts, tc);
657 }
658 MPFR_ZIV_FREE (loop);
659
660 inexs = (s == NULL) ? 0 : mpfr_set (s, ts, rnd);
661 inexc = (c == NULL) ? 0 : mpfr_set (c, tc, rnd);
662
663 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
664 return INEX(inexs,inexc);
665}
